member.name: T:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager
member.summary: Handles all communications with a certain QuantumX device and encapsulates the access to the (QuantumX framework dll)
member.remarks: All instance methods of this class may only be called by because of multi threading. All static methods of this class may only be called by , because the may only be called once.

member.summary: Connects to a device on the given ip address an port and returns the UUID of the connected device.

member.returns: UUID of the connected device
member.exception: Thrown if the ConnectionInfo instance is null
Thrown if device could not be connected.
Thrown if an unexpected error occurs

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.WaitUntilTedsHasFinishedParameterization(Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Channels.IQuantumXChannel,System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits the until the channels' TEDS parameterization is no longer busy. This should be possible not later than in about 30 seconds (MAX_TIME_IN_MS_UNTIL_DEVICE_IS_READY). During this time we check the TEDS status of the given channel and return true if we determine it within this time span.
member.param: Channel for which the TEDS status will be determined.
The timeout in ms (default is 30000ms, minimum is 5000ms).
member.returns: True, if TEDS parameterization has finished.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.DisconnectFromDevice
member.summary: Disconnects a connected QuantumX device

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.FillDeviceInfo
member.summary: Reads additional information from the hardware device and fills the data into the current device instance

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.GetPossibleDataAcquisitionModes
member.summary: Gets the possible data acquisition modes according to the current synchronization settings of the device. When the device detects a hardware synchronization (typically established via a synchronization cable), the returned list will will contain the mode . If the device uses a time based synchronization (e.g. PTP or NTP), the returned list will contain the mode . Since most devices are able to fulfill an unsynchronized measurement, the returned list will most likely contain the mode . If the device is not connected, the list of possible data acquisition modes will be empty.
member.returns: List of possible for this device according to its current synchronization settings.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.GetConnectors(Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.XmlViewType)
member.summary: Reads from all or the specified view all connectors and their dependent data (like channels and signals) from the hardware device and fills the data into a new list of connector instances. Since the additional connector view also contains the spectrum info, the spectrum info will also be read by this function!
member.param: The view to read from (optional), default is read from all (possible) views.
member.returns: New list of new instances.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.GetConnector(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a single connector at the given including the dependent data (like channels and signals) from the hardware device and fills the data into a new connector instance.
member.remarks: s are not read, because this is not required.
member.param: Position of the connector on the device
member.returns: A new instance

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.GetAndReplaceStandardConnectors
member.summary: Gets the the standard connectors from the device and replaces them in the object model.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.TransformOffConnectors(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Connectors.Connector})
member.summary: Transforms all OffConnectors of the given list into default connector types that are supported by the device. E.g.: For MX878, MX879 and MX410 all OffConnectors will be transformed into AnalogOutConnectors.
member.param: List that contains OffConnectors to transform into another connector type

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.TransformOffConnectorToAnalogOutConnector(Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Connectors.QuantumXOffConnector,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an including a channel and signal according to the given parameters.
member.param: QuantumXOffConnector that should be transformed into an QuantumXAnalogOutConnector
Module reference of the module to use for output
Signal reference of the signal within the given module to use for output
member.returns: Transformed AnalogOutConnector according to the given parameters

member.summary: Writes a connector to the module.
member.param: Connector to be assigned to the module.
member.returns: List of problems. If no problems have occured, an empty list is returned.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.CommunicationManager.WriteEnableConnector(Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.XmlViewType,System.Int32,Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.QuantumXEnableConnectorType)

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.Xml.XmlConnectorDataManager.GenerateExtendedSampleRateModeXml(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Connectors.IQuantumXConnector},System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the XML with the (analog input) connectors given by address position to enable or disable the extended sample-rate mode by the given mode (SpeedMode).
member.param: The connectors to be generated.
The mode (presently only 0=normal and 1=extended).
member.returns: XML data as string which represents the turned off connectors.
member.remarks:
To enable or disable the extended sample-rate mode (mode=1) all connectors need to be turned off beforehand (use ).
Enabling is only possible with one or two (1..2) connectors, while disabling should provide the of all connectors.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.Xml.XmlScalingDataManager
member.summary: Data manager for reading and creating scaling specific xml data.
member.remarks:
QuantumX only does not support . TwoPointScalings are converted to table scalings during the sensor assignment. QuantumX specific "Gain" scalings are converted into a table scaling when reading the sensor data from the hardware, because there are not supported by the common scalings.
All methods of this class may only be called by or from classes, which are derived from .

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Core.Xml.XmlScalingDataManager.ReadEngineeringUnit(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,Hbm.Api.SensorDB.Entities.Scaling)
member.summary:
Reads the engineering unit from the module. If the CHANNEL_OUTPUTUNIT tag is available (e.g. for AnalogInChannels), then the CHANNEL_OUTPUTUNIT_UNITID (unit code) is read and converted. If the conversion fails, then the CHANNEL_OUTPUTUNIT_USERTEXT (unit text) is read.
Else if the CHANNEL_OUTPUTUNIT tag is not available (e.g. for CANBUS) then the SENSOR_PHYSUNIT (unit code) is read and converted. If the conversion fails, then the SENSOR_PHYSUNITUSR (unit text) is read.
member.param: Root xml element of the sensor, to which the scaling belongs
Existing (concrete) scaling instance
member.returns: Engineering unit as string representation

member.param: Scaling to map to xml
member.returns: Xml data as string which represents the given caling

member.remarks: All methods of this class may only be called by . All (public / internal) methods of this class must be synchronized with to prevent concurrent access of multiple (different) devices, because the underlying C++ DLL is not thread safe.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.QuantumXCarrierFrequencyType
member.summary:
Carrier frequency type of the QuantumX.
The values of the enum match the QuantumX specific values for the excitation frequency in xml (corresponding to the enum enExcitationFreq in HBM_QX_Framework.h).
The additional values must match the part of type relevant values of the enumeration . The direct frequency values in Hz are part of the enumeration .
member.remarks:
HBM_QX_Framework.h:
enum enExcitationFreq { EXCFREQ_AUTO = 0, // type relevant EXCFREQ_DC = 1, // type relevant EXCFREQ_75HZ = 2, EXCFREQ_600HZ = 3, EXCFREQ_1200HZ = 4, EXCFREQ_4800HZ = 5, EXCFREQ_9600HZ = 6, EXCFREQ_AUTO_AC = 7, // type relevant EXCFREQ_225HZ = 8, EXCFREQ_UNKNOWN = ENUM_UNKNOWN };

member.name: F:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.QuantumXCarrierFrequencyType.Auto
member.summary: Auto

member.name: F:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.QuantumXCarrierFrequencyType.Dc
member.summary: DC

member.name: F:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.QuantumXCarrierFrequencyType.AutoAc
member.summary: Auto AC

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.QuantumXCarrierFrequencyValue
member.summary:
Carrier frequency value of the QuantumX.
The values of the enum match the QuantumX specific values for the excitation frequency in xml (corresponding to the enum enExcitationFreq in HBM_QX_Framework.h).
The additional values must match the part of the frequency values of the enumeration , which directly define a frequency value. The type relevant information is part of the enumeration .
member.remarks:
HBM_QX_Framework.h:
enum enExcitationFreq { EXCFREQ_AUTO = 0, EXCFREQ_DC = 1, EXCFREQ_75HZ = 2, // value relevant EXCFREQ_600HZ = 3, // value relevant EXCFREQ_1200HZ = 4, // value relevant EXCFREQ_4800HZ = 5, // value relevant EXCFREQ_9600HZ = 6, // value relevant EXCFREQ_AUTO_AC = 7, EXCFREQ_225HZ = 8, // value relevant EXCFREQ_UNKNOWN = ENUM_UNKNOWN };

member.summary:
Thermocouple type of the QuantumX.
The values of the enum match the QuantumX specific values for the ThermocoupleType in xml (corresponding to the enum enPtType in HBM_QX_Framework.h).
The additional values must match the thermocouple type according to the data field in the sensor database.

HBM_QX_Framework.h:
enum enTcType { TCTYPE_B = 0, TCTYPE_E = 1, TCTYPE_J = 2, TCTYPE_K = 3, TCTYPE_N = 4, TCTYPE_R = 5, TCTYPE_S = 6, TCTYPE_T = 7, TCTYPE_C = 8, TCTYPE_UNKNOWN = ENUM_UNKNOWN };

member.summary: A TEDS chip is available and OK.

member.summary: Create a new instance and initialize data
member.param: QuantumXDevice that supports the additional features

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXAdditionalFeatures.DisableConnector(Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Connectors.IQuantumXConnector,Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Connectors.QuantumXOffConnector@,System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem}@)
member.summary: Disables the given connector on the device. An new instance is generated and assigned to the device. The connector is automatically replaced by the new connector in the connectors list of the device.
member.param: Connector to be disabled on the module
New instance of the disabled connector as further reference to the connector
List of warnings and errors that occurred during disabling the connector
member.returns: true if no error has occurred, otherwise false

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXAdditionalFeatures.EnableConnector(Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Connectors.QuantumXOffConnector,Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Connectors.Connector@,System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem}@,Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Enums.QuantumXEnableConnectorType)
member.summary: Enables the given connector on the device. An new connector instance is generated at the position of the and is assigned to the device. The connector is automatically replaced by the new connector in the connectors list of the device.
member.param: Off connector to be enabled on the module
Enabled connector (output parameter) of type or as further reference to the connector
List of warnings and errors that occurred during enabling the connector
Type of the connector when enabled (optional).
member.returns: true if no error has occurred, otherwise false

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXAdditionalFeatures.EnableExtendedSampleRateMode(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.QuantumX.Connectors.IQuantumXConnector},System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem}@)
member.summary: Enables the extended sample-rate mode for the given connectors of the current module.
member.param: The connectors for the extended sample-rate mode.
List of warnings and errors that occurred during setting the extended sample-rate mode.
member.returns: true if no error has occurred, otherwise false.
member.remarks:
To date only MX403, MX410 and MX411 are capable of the extended sample-rate mode.
Only up to two connectors may be enabled, while all others will be disabled (turned off).

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXAdditionalFeatures.DisableExtendedSampleRateMode(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem}@)
member.summary: Disables the extended sample-rate mode and re-enables the normal mode for all connectors of the current module.
member.param: List of warnings and errors that occurred during the operation.
member.returns: true if no error has occurred, otherwise false.

member.summary: Default TCP/IP port for connecting with QuantumX devices

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXDevice.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new instance of the class and initializes the communication manager, the additional features and others. Use this constructor if the device can be found by the scan mechanism.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXDevice.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates new instance of the class and initializes the communication manager, the additional features and others. Use this constructor if the device must be connected without using the scan mechanism or if you want to connect to a device with a known IP address.
member.param: IP address of the device
Port for connecting the device (optional). This parameter is not optional, if the device is connected to a CX27. If this parameter is not set, the default connection port is used.

Streaming port (optional, if scan is available). If this parameter is not set, it will be set during the device connect (retrieved by the scan result). If the scan mechanism is not available, then this parameter is not optional . (try to use the default , if is unknown)

Http port, required for streaming (optional, if scan is available). If this parameter is not set, it will be set during the device connect (retrieved by the scan result). If the scan mechanism is not available, then this parameter is not optional. (try to use the default , if is unknown)

member.summary: Resets the device to its factory default settings. Caution! After this function has been called, the device will be disconnected. This is necessary because the parameterization of the device changes by loading the factory defaults and the device therefore will be no longer consistent with the associated object model of the device. (When implementing this function, be sure to disconnect the device and to call to signal that the device has been disconnected.)
member.param: Warnings and errors that occurred during resetting the device
member.returns: true if no error has occurred, otherwise false
member.remarks: Notice that the device may be unreachable for a certain time and the device is disconnected after the execution of this function.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXDevice.GetPossibleDataAcquisitionModes
member.summary: Gets the possible data acquisition modea according to the current synchronization settings of the device. When the device detects a hardware synchronization (typically established via a synchronization cable), the returned list will contain the mode . If the device uses a time based synchronization (e.g. PTP or NTP), the returned list will contain the mode . Since most devices are able to fulfill an unsynchronized measurement, the returned list will most likely contain the mode . If the device is not connected, the list of possible data acquisition modes will be empty.
member.returns: List of possible for this device according to its current synchronization settings.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXDevice.CheckAndAddCanBusSupplyProblem(Hbm.Api.SensorDB.Entities.Sensor,Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Connectors.Connector,System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem})
member.summary:
Adds a problem if check for fitting supply voltages fails. If device supports supply for the can bus(), this function checks if fits to . If is set to 0 we do not take the sensor into account.
We have to generate this problem by ourselves because Quantum ignores it but we should give a hint to the user!
member.param: Sensor to check if it fits to the current supply voltage of the CanConnector
Connector to which the sensor is connected
Problems to be extended if the supply voltage of the connector does not fit to the one of the sensor

member.summary: Gets the possible data acquisition modes by taking into account all given devices of the family. CommonTimeSource is set to the timesource that is used by all devices of the family (only relevant if is supported by the given devices).
member.param: Devices that belong to the family and take part in the measurement
TimeSource that is supported by all devices (typically e.g. an )
member.returns: Possible s according to the possibilities of the given devices.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.QuantumX.QuantumXDeviceFamily.PrepareDataAcquisition(Hbm.Api.Common.Enums.DataAcquisitionMode,System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Device})
member.summary: Function to do final device settings according to the given . Use this function to setup e.g. trigger master and trigger slave, choose certain time stamp settings etc. which is relevant for the given data acquisition mode. Since all devices of a certain device family, that take part in the measurement are also given to this function, there is the possibility to handle certain devices in different ways (e.g. trigger master gets other settings/preparations than the slaves etc.).
member.param: that describes how to start the measurement
Devices of the family that take part in the measurement
member.remarks: Do not use but one of the DataAcquisitionModes returned by the function
